thread.title: CMC Dance Company haunted house closed for 2015, but will return 'bigger and better'
thread.title_full: CMC Dance Company haunted house closed for 2015, but will return 'bigger and better' | syracuse.com

author: Katrina Tulloch | ktulloch@syracuse.com
title: CMC Dance Company haunted house closed for 2015, but will return 'bigger and better'
text:
CICERO N.Y. -- The CMC Dance Company's beloved haunted house will not return this October, due to a major expansion project on the property.
The CMC Dance Studio broke ground on renovations and construction last December to expand the space from 5,000 square feet to 11,500 square feet.
"We practically tripled the space and tripled the parking, which was always an issue during the haunted house," said CMC Dance Company owner and artistic director Marjorie Taylor. "We finished as much as we could, but unfortunately it would have been too difficult to plan the haunted house as well."
More than 100 volunteer dance students and parents create the haunt, which draws hundreds of visitors annually. Every haunted house at CMC is different, with changing scenes and characters. This year, there wasn't enough time to develop a brand new haunt from scratch.
"We love doing it and we're feeling really bad not to do it this year for the town," Taylor said. "We hire police officers to help us and everything. This year, parents felt they would be way too stressed to pack it all in a short time."
Haunted house preparation usually takes four to six months at the studio. This year would have been the 14th annual haunted house.
Taylor said not to worry, though, because the popular haunt will return next year "bigger and better than ever" in the newly-renovated space.
CMC Dance Company is located at 6092 Route 31, Cicero. Taylor's husband, David, owns the property.
